summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing updates to a public webpage regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's case. It includes a trivial inquiry about a rumor regarding Dan Snyder and confirms the posting of details about Maxwell's July 14, 2019 arraignment, bail hearing, and trial scheduling.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, who entered a plea of not guilty to the Superseding Indictment and was ordered incarcerated pending trial.

persons.name: Dan Snyder
persons.context: Owner of the Washington Redskins; a TMZ reporter inquired about a rumor that he was about to be arrested in connection with the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, scheduled to oversee the trial beginning July 12, 2021.

connections.description: A rumor mentioned by a TMZ reporter suggested Dan Snyder might be arrested in connection with the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, implying a potential, unconfirmed association.

events.title: Maxwell Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: An arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing were held for Ghislaine Maxwell. She pleaded not guilty to the Superseding Indictment and was ordered incarcerated pending trial. The court scheduled discovery and motion deadlines and set a trial date.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date for Maxwell
events.description: The trial for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to begin before Judge Alison J. Nathan.

locations: Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York
keyFacts: On July 14, 2019, Ghislaine Maxwell pleaded not guilty to the Superseding Indictment and was ordered incarcerated pending trial.
Maxwell's trial was scheduled for July 12, 2021, before Judge Alison J. Nathan at the Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse in New York.
A TMZ reporter inquired about a rumor that Washington Redskins owner Dan Snyder was about to be arrested in connection with the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
The email chain shows internal U.S. Attorney's Office coordination on updating public case information for Ghislaine Maxwell.
